item.title: Paramount Poised to Win Bidding War For Warner Bros. As Netflix Backs Out
item.content:encoded:
Paramount appears to have defeated Netflix in the bidding war for Warner Bros. On February 26, Netflix declined to raise its bid for the legendary entertainment studio, leaving Paramount as the frontrunner to purchase WB.

Netflix issued an official statement, citing Warner Bros.’s belief that Paramount Skydance’s latest proposal was “superior.” Per The Hollywood Reporter, Paramount’s revised offer includes a cash purchase price of $31.00 per WBD share, a daily ticking fee of $0.25 per quarter starting after September 30, 2026, and a $7 billion regulatory termination fee if the deal doesn’t close due to regulatory issues.

“The transaction we negotiated would have created shareholder value with a clear path to regulatory approval. However, we’ve always been disciplined, and at the price required to match Paramount Skydance’s latest offer, the deal is no longer financially attractive, so we are declining to match the Paramount Skydance bid,” read Netflix’s statement.

Netflix Seemed Like a Lock to Purchase Warner Bros.

On December 5, Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery reached an agreement valued at $82.7 billion under which Netflix would acquire Warner Bros.’ streaming and studio assets, including Warner Bros. Games. Meanwhile, Paramount made at least eight unsuccessful offers to buy Warner Bros., and even sued Warner in January, but persistence ultimately paid off.

Warner has numerous immensely popular properties, including the DC Comics universe, the Harry Potter franchise, and Game of Thrones. Now, that’s all seemingly heading to Paramount. Insider Gaming will report any further updates to this story.

What do you think about this development? Do you think they will merge streaming properties as part of this deal? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Does Marathon Have Duos? All Solos, Duos, Trios & Quads Matchmaking Options, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Marathon is the big-time extraction shooter in 2026, looking to knock others off their perch, but the existence (or lack of) Solo, Duo, Trio, and Quad matchmaking could be a big positive or negative.

You could say that Marathon‘s success could bungie (pun intended), depending on how matchmaking goes. The game is designed with a particular team size in mind, but this might be off-putting to certain players or groups. All will be explained.

Can You Queue For Duos in Marathon?

Marathon does not have a Duo queue option, meaning you cannot specifically look and enter a match with just two players—depending on how your matchmaking goes.

In short, the only conceivable way for you and a friend to enter a game of Marathon together is to party up and hope that a third player is not put on your team for whatever reason.

  • More Insider Gaming: Factions In Marathon, Explained

This isn’t a big surprise, because extraction shooter fans will likely remember that the ever-popular ARC Raiders also didn’t launch with a dedicated Duos matchmaking playlist option.

Duos wasn’t present during the Marathon Server Slam Playtest, so the option will either be made available for launch or Bungie will add it in after launch as a fresh content option.

One thing’s almost for sure: If you ask for Duos, it will come.

All Marathon Matchmaking Options, Explained

Marathon has two default matchmaking options for you to trigger: Solos and Trios.

If you choose your matchmaking to feature ‘No Fill,’ then no other human players will be added to your squad, and this is essentially Solos, without explicitly labeling it as that.

As we’ve established, there is no Duos playlist option whatsoever. Marathon’s default squad number is three, and the basis of the gameplay revolves around a three-man squad—so don’t see Trios leaving the matchmaking settings ever.

  • More Insider Gaming: How To Earn Marathon Server Slam Twitch Drops

Finally, there is no Quads option as you physically cannot have four players in a team. Once again, this might be a thing well after the game’s main launch in March 2026, but there is no Quad setting for the time being.

Extraction shooters all have their own nuances. In this instance, it feels like Marathon is following in ARC Raiders’ launch boots. Does a lack of dedicated Duos or Quads put you off playing? Do you think Bungie will add one or more of these options in the future?

Before you dive into another raid, share your matchmaking opinions, complaints, and compliments through the Insider Gaming Discord, where you can talk about Marathon in general.

Make sure you check out ARC Raiders’ viewer count hitting new lows as Marathon started running.

item.title: Stage Tour, RedOctane’s Rhythm Game Revival, Set for Fall 2026
item.content:encoded:
Stage Tour is the official name of the rhythm game revival attempt from RedOctane Games. A reveal trailer states that the game will be out later this year.

There was a time when rhythm games like Guitar Hero and Rock Band ruled the industry, and living rooms were shapeshifted into grand stages. Now, RedOctane is ready for you to get the band back together with their upcoming game, and they’re not doing it alone.

A press release states that the development studio reached a multi-year agreement with Gibson to bring more authenticity to the stage.

“For a generation of players, rhythm games transformed music from something you listened to into something you lived—inspiring countless people to pick up real instruments and explore their creativity,” says Taylor Berryman, Sr. Manager, Lifestyle & Licensing at Gibson. “Stage Tour is the next evolution of that influence. We’re thrilled to partner with RedOctane to reimagine what rhythm gaming can be and to spark deeper connection, creativity, and a lifelong love of music for generations to come.”

RedOctane has also partnered with Epiphone and Kramer. The studio has already confirmed that a Gibson Kramer guitar controller will be part of the purchasable bundle when the game is released later this year.

More Details on Stage Tour

An FAQ on the official website for the video game notes that it will largely focus on Rock and Metal music. However, other genres may show up at a later time. Aspiring and established artists who want to be featured in the game can contact them and use a form to license their music. “Terminator Oscillator” by Static-X was featured in the trailer.

Stage Tour is also giving players the chance to create the band lineup of their dreams. The game can be played with up to four players. Players can mix any lineup of Lead, Groove, Drums, and Vocals. Each role has its own dedicated peripherals, and it’s fully compatible with gamepads and keyboards.

RedOctane’s Rhythm Game Roots

News of this project first surfaced in August 2025. Major names tied to past rhythm game franchises are working on this project. Notably, Simon Ebejer, the Production Director on several Guitar Hero titles during his time at Neversoft, is tied to the project.

Also, Charles and Kai Huang, the original founders of the Guitar Hero franchise, have joined RedOctane’s special advisory board.

The game is currently scheduled to come to PC and a wide variety of platforms. No specific platforms have been announced, however. Insider Gaming will continue to monitor everything surrounding the release of the upcoming rhythm game and report any and all updates.

item.title: He-Man: Dragon Pearl of Destruction Releases in April
item.content:encoded:
The new beat ’em up game set in the world of He-Man now has a release date. Get ready to battle across Eternia when He-Man & the Masters of the Universe: Dragon Pearl of Destruction releases on April 28, 2026.

Limited Run Games announced the release date in a new gameplay trailer during IGN Fan Fest. The trailer’s description noted that there would be 12 stages in the game. Players can choose between four playable characters: He-Man, She-Ra, Man-At-Arms, and Teela. Also, local co-op mode is advertised.

Check out the full trailer, which feels like it stepped right out of the ’80s, below:

Beat ‘Em Ups Featuring Nostalgic IPs Are All the Rage

He-Man & the Masters of the Universe: Dragon Pearl of Destruction attempts to capture the gaming style of the late 80s and early 90s through its sprite work and mechanics. However, it is far from the only game resurrecting nostalgic IP with such a video game. Marvel Cosmic Invasion gave new life to Marvel Comics’ heroes with this game style in 2025. Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Rita’s Rewind and G.I. Joe: Wrath of Cobra all take a similar approach.

Limited Run Games is also responsible for bringing back a lot of classic beat ’em up games. They recently released the Fighting Force Collection, revitalizing that PS1-era classic duology. Also, they recently announced the Marvel MaXimum Collection.

This forthcoming collection of games will allow players to purchase classic titles from the 16-bit era, such as X-Men: The Arcade Game and Spider-Man & Venom: Maximum Carnage. Learn more about the upcoming collection here.

Insider Gaming will continue to provide any information regarding He-Man & the Masters of the Universe: Dragon Pearl of Destruction leading up to its release. The game will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch, and PC.

Are you excited for this upcoming He-Man game? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Factions In Marathon, Explained—How To Unlock New Factions & Increase Their Rank
item.content:encoded:
The latest entry into extraction shooters is here, as Marathon has broken onto the scene at long last. As fun as it is to loot and shoot your way through Tau Ceti, some direction is always nice, and for that, you’ll need to familiarise yourself with Factions.

There are six of them to work with in Marathon, but you’ll only have access to one of them out of the gates. If you’re looking to make some progress, you’ll want to unlock them all as soon as possible, as they each have unique offerings you’ll want to take advantage of.

Here’s how to unlock each of the six Factions in Marathon, as well as how to increase their Rank.

What Are Factions In Marathon?

Factions are essential to your progression whilst playing Marathon, with each one offering you selections of gear to purchase and Contracts to complete in return for a variety of rewards.

As you work your way through Marathon, you’ll quickly realise that Contracts are the biggest source of progression in the game, and there appear to be two varieties of them to complete, which are:

  • Standard Contracts: Repeatable missions you can complete for the given Faction, which vary in difficulty and rewards
  • Priority Contracts: One-time missions that are essential to the faction. These are tied to progression and help boost your Faction Rank, as well as offering significant story relevance

You can only have one Contract active at a time, and you must select which one you’d like to work on before going out on your next run. That means no multitasking—you’ll have to think about the purpose of every run you go out on.

  • More Insider Gaming: Every Runner Shell In Marathon

Each Faction offers a unique set of Contracts, but frustratingly, you won’t have access to them all out of the gate. You’ll need to unlock them all if you want to truly progress through Marathon, so here’s how you can get that done.

How To Unlock Factions In Marathon

If you want to unlock the other five Factions in Marathon, you’ll need to complete a special type of contract—the Liaison Contract.

You’ll begin to unlock these pretty early into the game; you’ll just need to complete the tutorial and the Welcome To Tau Ceti Contract.

Once they’re finished, you’ll unlock Liaison Contracts. These are unique Contracts that get you in touch with a new Faction, with each one having its own Liaison to complete. You’ll only have to do these once, as a Faction is unlocked permanently upon Contract completion.

That being said, it’s one thing to unlock the Faction, but you’ll want to rank up with them, too. The higher their Rank, the more useful they’ll be to you, so that should be your next priority.

How To Rank Up Factions In Marathon

To rank up Factions in Marathon, you’ll need to complete Contracts for each of the Factions, with different Contracts offering varying amounts of Rep.

Rep is the currency used to rank up Factions, though it’s utilised automatically. It’s important to rank the Factions up, as the higher the rank they are, the better gear you’ll have access to. Also, at certain milestones, you’ll unlock various reward packages, as well as new Standard Contracts.

  • More Insider Gaming: Bungie Outlines Plans To Counter Cheaters In Marathon

That’s not all, though, as each Faction has its own selection of Upgrades for you to invest in. These vary drastically between Factions, with some offering improved Vault Space, whilst others offer various permanent Stat upgrades for your Runner. You’ll want to look into these thoroughly, as they’re crucial to building your Runner to suit your playstyle, and you’ll need to know which resources to keep an eye out for on your next run.
